III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
Description suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that a staff person touched a youth.
Investigation Collaboration with DHHS Worker was initiated via telephone
on 04/16/24.
Interviews were conducted jointly with DHHS Worker except for
Staff 2 and Maintenance Person.
Staff 1 was interviewed via Teams on 04/17/2024. Staff 1 is the
foster care worker for Youth D and the manager of Angel House.
Staff 1 reported Youth D went truant from the program on
4/10/2024 and her sister had picked her up and transported her to
Chicago. Staff 1 reported Youth D’s sister reported Youth D did
not feel safe as a man had touched her. Staff 1 further reported
Youth D’s sister did not respond when asked what man was
touching her and where this occurred. Staff 1 reported Youth D
never informed her she did not feel safe at the program. Staff 1
reported contact with Youth D has not occurred as the phone
number for Youth D is blocked.
The Child Welfare Director was interviewed via Teams on
04/17/2024. The Child Welfare Director reported Youth D had
made similar allegations while placed at another agency and tries
to get out of placement by making allegations. The Child Welfare
Director added that contact with Youth D has been unsuccessful
as her phone number is blocked. She reported there is no
disciplinary action against Staff 2. No other additional information
was provided.
2

The Child Welfare Supervisor was interviewed via Teams on
04/17/2024. The Child Welfare Supervisor reported there is one
part time male staff, hereafter referred to as Staff 2, that works an
irregular schedule, working as needed. The Child Welfare
Supervisor reported Staff 2 has worked at the agency since April
2020 and there have never been any complaints lodged against
him by the female independent living (IL) youth who reside in
Angel House. The Child Welfare Supervisor added that any of the
female IL youth would have informed her of any inappropriateness
by Staff 2. The Child Welfare Supervisor reported Staff 2 is used
for emergency fill in if the agency is short staffed or transports are
needed. The Child Welfare Supervisor reported the IL residents
like Staff 2 and get along with him. The Child Welfare Supervisor
reported Staff 2 does not go into resident bedrooms and most
often remains in an office as a staff person on duty. The Child
Welfare Supervisor reported there is a male contractual worker
who does periodic maintenance at Angel House as he mainly
helps in “flipping rooms”. The Child Welfare Supervisor reported
that Maintenance Person does not have unsupervised interaction
with youth. The Child Welfare Supervisor reported there have
never been any complaints lodged against him by the residents.
The Child Welfare Supervisor reported there has been no contact
with Youth D as calls from the agency to Youth D are blocked.
Youth A was interviewed via Teams on 04/17/2024. Youth A
reported she likes the program and feels safe. Youth A denied that
any staff had ever made her feel unsafe. Youth A reported she
likes Staff 2 and never has had any issue with him.
Youth B was interviewed via Teams on 04/17/2024. Youth B
reported that she likes the program, and it is helping her move
forward with her life. Youth B reported she does not have any
issue with any of the staff. Youth B specifically reported she has
never had any issues with Staff 2 and that she likes him. Youth B
reported when Staff 2 comes on duty he will knock on resident’s
bedroom doors while announcing that he is the staff now on duty
and to make sure everyone is accounted for.
Youth C was interviewed via Teams on 04/17/2024. Youth C
reported her placement at Angel House is “alright”. Youth C
reported she has never had concerns about Staff 2 and that he is
“very professional”. Youth C reported when Staff 2 arrives to work
he will knock on bedroom doors announcing his arrival to work
and that he is the staff on duty.
3

Youth D was unable to be interviewed as she was AWOL from
the agency and the agency was unsuccessful in making contact
with her. Attempts were made to contact Youth D via phone and
were unsuccessful. The DHHS Worker sent a text message to
Youth D’s sister on 04/23/24, with no response.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 04/29/2024. Staff 2
reported he works part time at the agency, anywhere from 16-100
hours a month, usually on Mondays. Staff 2 reported when he
arrives to work, usually around 4:45 PM, he makes a round to
notify residents that he is the staff on duty and to check if all
residents are accounted for. Staff 2 reported he mostly watches
the agency camera system from an office to observe what
residents are coming and going from the facility. Staff 2 reported
Youth D is usually absent from the facility until later in the evening.
Staff 2 reported he does not recall speaking with Youth D and saw
her one time in person when Youth D was in the common area.
Staff 2 reported he was unaware of Youth D complaining about
anyone. Staff 2 denied touching Youth D or any or the residents
inappropriately.
The Maintenance Person was interviewed via telephone on
05/15/2024. The Maintenance Person reported he is not an
employee of the agency but contracts with them to perform
maintenance functions. The Maintenance Person reported he
works about 20 hours per week servicing three agency facilities.
The Maintenance Person reported he services Angel House
infrequently, mostly preparing a vacated room for the next
resident. The Maintenance Person reported he works 9 am to 5
pm, Monday through Friday. The Maintenance Person reported he
tries to stay away from any interaction with residents as he
understands an adult male might make them uncomfortable. The
Maintenace Person denied he has unsupervised interaction with
youth, and he closes the bedroom door when he is doing room
maintenance. Maintenace Person denied he has ever touched a
youth inappropriately.
DOCUMENT REVIEW: A review of the case file for Youth D did
not add anything to the investigation.
Analysis The agency was found in compliance as The Child Welfare
Director, Child Welfare Supervisor, and Staff 1 had not received
any complaints from Youth D about any male staff touching her
inappropriately. Staff 2 denied touching Youth D in any way. Youth
A, B, and C reported they feel safe at the program and they like
Staff 2. The Maintenance Person reported he has limited contact
4

with residents. The Child Welfare Supervisor reported there have
not been any complaints about the Maintenance Person.
The complaint did not identify what male staff had touched Youth
D. Phone calls were placed to Youth D by the DHHS Worker and
this Consultant. Youth D’s phone did not ring and there was a
recording stating that the person you are trying to reach cannot be
contacted at this time.
The DHHS Worker did not have any findings.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
